H0.text: what was the first video game for nintendo. Sheriff

H1.text: what was the first video game for nintendo. Radar Scope

H2.text: what was the first video game for nintendo. Space Fever

H3.text: what was the first video game for nintendo. EVR Race

A4.text: Nintendo had briefly experimented with electro-mechanical arcade gun games such as Wild Gunman and the Laser Clay Shooting System, followed by arcade video games such as EVR-Race, Sheriff, Space Fever, and the Color TV-Game line of dedicated home consoles.

A5.text: Nintendo's first foray into video gaming was the arcade game Computer Othello in 1978.

A6.text: The Color TV-Game is the first video game system ever made by Nintendo.

A7.text: Sheriff, released in 1979, was Nintendo's first original video game.

A8.text: EVR Race was the company's first electromechanical game, while Sheriff was its first original video game.
